# I broke this up into manual testing for edge/corner cases and then randomized tests for everything else.  For the edge/corner cases I coverred the cases where B is the max and min integer and zero.  I also tested when Cin was 0 and 1 and I tested when Sa was at its min and max value as well with different combos of b  and sa.  This coverred the edge cases and most corner cases for the operations.  These tests are in base 10. 
# Then all of the 200 randomized test cases should have generated test cases that would test all branches of the circuit that was made.  That means testing different combinations of the shifters being used out of the 16,8,4,2 and 1 bit shiters that are subcircuits of the 32bit left shifter that we are testing. These tests are in binary and by chance also coverred some corner cases.  


B[32] Sa[5] Cin C[32]

# edge/corner cases
0 0 0 0 # testing case where all inputs are zero 
2147483647 0 0 2147483647 # testing B = max signed int is handled for a shift of zero 
-2147483648 0 0 -2147483648 # testig B =  min signed int is handled for a shift of zero 
1 31 0 -2147483648 # tesing to see if max shift value works correctly and ensures that cin of zero works
1 2 1 7 # testing to see if Cin of 1 works correctly 

# python randomly geenrated cases 

11000111111001110000111100100110 00000 1 11000111111001110000111100100110
